title: Enhancement - Security at the Folder Level
author: flyer292
body_snippet:
As we already have the ability to use SQL and AD integration it would be great if we could restrict access at the folder levels.  This would allow the ability to share connections with other members of our teams, but also allow us to restrict who has access to what sections within the application

Also having a local and centralized credentials manager would help as well with this

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: that should be working a bit different, on SQL level it should be ACL, for a user and that user should see connections only that allow to see him by ACL, that means that we should have 3 type of account for SQL - "admin" - to be able create table (or that can be done with SQL management by appropriate process and team who control such), "manager" - with full permissions to write to table, and "user" - to read only.
